alert.note: Alert for Clay (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 10:02AM CST until February 26 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee affecting Clay County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee. * WHEN...From late tonight to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.5 feet, Flood water is covering the gravel road south of West Point that leads to the Tibbee Creek bridge near Tibbee. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 23.6 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Tibbee Creek Tibbee 23.0 22.0 Wed 9 am CST 23.4 23.3 22.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued this evening at 7 PM CST.
